article: 55 I did very badly at school. My headmaster thought I was _ and when I was 14 he said, You're never going to be _ but a failure. After five years of _ jobs, I fell in love with a very nice middle-class girl. It was the best _ that could have happened to me. I _ to do something positive with my life because I wanted to prove to _ that what people said about me was _ . Especially her mother, who had said to me, Let's _ it, you've failed at everything you've ever done. So I tried hard with my _ and went to college. My first novel _ while I was at college. After college I taught during the _ in high schools and attended evening classes at London University, where I got a _ in history. I became a lecturer at a college and was thinking of _ that job to write full time _ I was offered a part-time job at Leeds University. I began to feel proud of myself _ was a working-class boy who'd _ school early, now teaching at the university. My writing career took off when I discovered my own style. Now I'm rich and _ , have been on TV, and met lots of film stars. _ what does it mean? I _ wish all the people that have put me down had _ : I believe in you. You'll succeed.
